title.narrative: F.a: Supporting Burundian civil society in monitoring and advocacy

description.narrative: The aim of the project is to promote peace process in Burundi and contribute international community to support of a comprehensive resolution to the ongoing political crisis in Burundi. The project seeks to increase awareness of the human rights situation in Burundi and advocates this at the internation level. This project will allow Atrocities Watch to continue and expand its monitoring and advocacy work in support of a comprehensive resolution to the ongoing political crisis in Burundi. The project is to be executed in cooperation with two key Burundian partners, the Forum pour le Renforcement de la Societe Civil au Burundi (FORSC) and the Mouvement des Femmes et des Filles pour la Paix et la Securite (MFFPS). The project will support the continuation of j oint AWA/FORSC monitoring inside Burundi, with a particular focus on the situation of internally displaced persons. This monitoring will also be expanded into refugee hosting countries in the region, allowing the organisations to document both the reasons for flight and violations of refugee rights. On the advocacy side, AWA will support both organizations to make their voices heard by translating their products and opinions into products that are accessible to policymakers, improving outreach with these pr oducts using electronic distribution and social media and supporting in person meetings between Burundian advocates and international policy makers. Through these efforts, we will ensure that local voices are heard and heeded and that local understanding i nfuses international engagement.
